subject: Re: [junit] DynaMock EasyMock JMock?
msgSnippet: Hi Deirdre, ... Any such recommendation would be by and large a personal preference rather than a de facto standard. Personally, I ve used EasyMock for a lot
messageBody:
Hi Deirdre,

On 2/16/07, dee101_1999 <delee@...> wrote:
> So what's the latest recommendation of a mock object implementation
> when testing database applications?

Any such recommendation would be by and large a personal preference
rather than a de facto standard. Personally, I've used EasyMock for a
lot of my dynamic mock object needs but I've also used bits of the old
"mockobjects.com" library (which provides a bunch of test doubles for
standard Java interfaces, including "java.sql.*") for testing JDBC
code. Nowadays, however, I've tended to turn to the test doubles
provided as part of the MockRunner library
(http://mockrunner.sourceforge.net/doc/api/index.html -->
"com.mockrunner.mock.jdbc").

Lasse
